refnamediv.refpurpose: look up the IP address(es) of a domain name

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: dnsip looks up A resource records for fqdn in the Domain Name System and prints the IP address(es) of fqdn on a single line. If fqdn does not exist, dnsip prints a blank line. You can list several fqdns; dnsip prints each result on a separate line.
Normally dnsip exits 0. If it encounters a temporary problem that prevents it from determining the list of IP addresses, it prints an error message and exits 111.
dnsip makes all DNS lookups using the locally configured DNS proxy server. See dnsqr1 for how this server is found.

a tool that looks up the domain name(es) of an IP address

refsection.title: History
refsection.para: dnsip was originally part of DanielJ.Bernstein's djbdns toolset in 1999.
